short_description: Outputs volume-weighted average price (VWAP) based on specified interval
long_description: The VWAP function computes the volume-weighted average price of a traded item (usually an equity share) for each time interval in a series of equal-length time intervals. Where

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The table containing the input data.
input_tables.description: The table containing the input data.

argument_clauses.name: Price
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the price at which the item traded. The default value is 'price'.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the price at which the item traded. Default: 'price'

argument_clauses.name: Volume
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the number of units traded in the transaction. The default value is 'volume'.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the number of units traded in the transaction. Default: 'volume'

argument_clauses.name: TimeColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the date and time of the trade. The default value is 'dt'.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the date and time of the trade. Default: 'dt'

argument_clauses.name: TimeInterval
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of seconds in each time interval. The default value is 0, which makes each row an interval, causing the function to calculate no averages.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the number of seconds in each time interval. Default: 0 (Each row is an interval, and the function calculates no averages.)

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
